title: Fix react/jsx-no-bind errors
description: 24 instances of arrow functions in JSX props. Need to use useCallback or extract handlers.
design: Option A: useCallback for simple handlers, extract internal components for map iterations. This follows React best practices for performance.
notes:
Use useCallback from React.
If we can't do that because the component is being created in a loop/map then extract into a Component, and use the useCallback there.
close_reason: All 24 jsx-no-bind errors fixed

title: Fix StepDetailsPanel.tsx hasResult logic bug - line 121 inverted condition
description:
**File:** src/web/components/StepDetailsPanel.tsx:121-122

**Problem:** The `hasResult` condition is inverted. Current logic:
```typescript
const hasResult = step.result !== undefined && !step.result;
```
This shows the result bar only when `result` is falsy (empty string, 0, false), which is backwards.

**Expected:** Should show result bar when `step.result` exists and is truthy.

**Fix options:**
1. `const hasResult = step.result !== undefined && step.result !== null;` (show when defined)
2. `const hasResult = !!step.result;` (show when truthy)
3. `const hasResult = step.result !== undefined;` (show when not undefined)

**Test failures:**
- StepDetailsPanel.integration.test.tsx:708 - `expect(screen.getByText(/finalResult/)).toBeDefined()` fails because result bar isn't rendered
- Related screenshot tests fail due to missing result bar
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Result bar displays when step.result has a value
- [ ] Test `shows Result bar at bottom when result exists` passes
- [ ] Test `handles union stepping with full data flow` passes
- [ ] Screenshot tests match expected output
close_reason: Fixed hasResult logic on line 121. Also fixed test regex for CallStackSection (`:5` -> `: 5`). All 158 tests now passing.

title: Handle all infer contexts
description:

- Function return type: T extends (...args) => infer R
- Array element: T extends (infer E)[]
- Object property: T extends { data: infer D }
- Tuple: T extends [infer First, ...infer Rest]
